thread.title: Stars out for Spectre world premiere
thread.title_full: Stars out for Spectre world premiere

title: Stars out for Spectre world premiere
text:
Stars out for Spectre world premiere 26 October 2015 From the section Entertainment & Arts Image copyright EPA Image caption Spectre stars (from left) Monica Bellucci, Daniel Craig and Lea Seydoux The stars of the new James Bond film Spectre will walk the red carpet later for its world premiere in London. 
Daniel Craig, Christoph Waltz and Lea Seydoux will meet Prince William, his wife Kate and Prince Harry ahead of the screening at the Royal Albert Hall. 
Other cast members include Andrew Scott, Naomie Harris, Ben Whishaw, Monica Bellucci and Ralph Fiennes. 
It is the first time a Bond film has opened in cinemas on the same day as the premiere. 
The film goes on general release on Monday in the UK and Ireland. 
Spectre, the 24th official entry in the franchise, sees Bond battling a criminal syndicate led by Franz Oberhauser, played by Waltz. 
It is directed by Skyfall's Sam Mendes, who will also be on the red carpet with producers Michael G Wilson and Barbara Broccoli. Image copyright MGM/Columbia/Eon Image caption Spectre is Daniel Craig's fourth stint as 007 
Spectre is the third Bond film chosen for the Royal Film Performance since its inception in 1946. It follows previous premieres for Die Another Day (2002) and Skyfall (2012). 
Early reviews have been positive, with some critics awarding the film five stars. 
Speaking to the BBC last week, Craig said he had not made any decisions about whether he would carry on playing 007. Image caption Red carpet preparations are well underway at the Royal Albert Hall 
The actor, on his fourth outing as the superspy, had told Time Out magazine that he would "rather slash [his] wrists" than make a fifth Bond film. 
But he told the BBC's Lizo Mzimba: "I'm quite straightforward and I say things when I feel it and then I change my mind. I'm just like everybody else." 
Spectre was shot at Pinewood Studios and filmed on location in London, Mexico City, Rome and Tangier and Erfoud, in Morocco. 
The shadowy organisation Spectre - which was previously an acronym for the Special Executive for Counter-Intelligence, Terrorism, Revenge and Extortion - last made an appearance in 1971's Diamonds Are Forever, with Sean Connery as Bond.
